description: The thread stack parameter default_stack_size_kb and worker_stack_size_kb determines the amount a data a newly created thread can access.

queries.name: q_allocation_limit
queries.sql: select count(*) AS VALUE from M_SERVICE_MEMORY where ALLOCATION_LIMIT > '252329328640' and SERVICE_NAME='indexserver'

queries.name: q_default_stack_size_kb
queries.sql: SELECT VALUE FROM M_INIFILE_CONTENTS WHERE FILE_NAME = 'global.ini' AND SECTION= 'threads' AND KEY = 'default_stack_size_kb' AND (LAYER_NAME = 'DATABASE' OR LAYER_NAME = 'DEFAULT') AND VALUE > '0' ORDER BY LAYER_NAME ASC LIMIT 1

queries.name: q_worker_stack_size_kb
queries.sql: SELECT VALUE FROM M_INIFILE_CONTENTS WHERE FILE_NAME = 'global.ini' AND SECTION= 'threads' AND KEY = 'worker_stack_size_kb' AND (LAYER_NAME = 'DATABASE' OR LAYER_NAME = 'DEFAULT') AND VALUE > '0' ORDER BY LAYER_NAME ASC LIMIT 1

actions.description: At least one of the stack size parameters is less than 2048 KB. To address the crash and termination of Indexserver caused by stack overflow, It is recommended to increase the size of the stack size parameters default_stack_size_kb and worker_stack_size_kb to 2048 in systems with more than 235 GB allocation limit.
